class.name: Word.TableCell
class.description: Represents a table cell in a Word document.

properties.name: body
properties.description: Gets the body object of the cell.

properties.name: cellIndex
properties.description: Gets the index of the cell in its row.

properties.name: columnWidth
properties.description: Specifies the width of the cell's column in points. This is applicable to uniform tables.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: horizontalAlignment
properties.description: Specifies the horizontal alignment of the cell. The value can be 'Left', 'Centered', 'Right', or 'Justified'.

properties.name: parentRow
properties.description: Gets the parent row of the cell.

properties.name: parentTable
properties.description: Gets the parent table of the cell.

properties.name: rowIndex
properties.description: Gets the index of the cell's row in the table.

properties.name: shadingColor
properties.description: Specifies the shading color of the cell. Color is specified in "#RRGGBB" format or by using the color name.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Specifies the text of the cell.

properties.name: verticalAlignment
properties.description: Specifies the vertical alignment of the cell. The value can be 'Top', 'Center', or 'Bottom'.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Gets the width of the cell in points.

methods.name: deleteColumn
methods.description: Deletes the column containing this cell. This is applicable to uniform tables.

methods.name: deleteRow
methods.description: Deletes the row containing this cell.

methods.name: getBorder
methods.description: Gets the border style for the specified border.

params.name: borderLocation
params.description: The border location.

params.name: borderLocation
params.description: The border location.

params.name: cellPaddingLocation
params.description: The cell padding location must be 'Top', 'Left', 'Bottom', or 'Right'.

params.name: cellPaddingLocation
params.description: The cell padding location must be 'Top', 'Left', 'Bottom', or 'Right'.

methods.name: getNext
methods.description: Gets the next cell. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if this cell is the last one.

methods.name: getNextOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the next cell. If this cell is the last one, returns an object with `isNullObject` set to `true`. For further information, see [OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

methods.name: insertColumns
methods.description: Adds columns to the left or right of the cell, using the cell's column as a template. This is applicable to uniform tables. The string values, if specified, are set in the newly inserted rows.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: It must be 'Before' or 'After'.

params.name: columnCount
params.description: Number of columns to add.

params.name: values
params.description: Optional 2D array. Cells are filled if the corresponding strings are specified in the array.

methods.name: insertRows
methods.description: Inserts rows above or below the cell, using the cell's row as a template. The string values, if specified, are set in the newly inserted rows.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: It must be 'Before' or 'After'.

params.name: rowCount
params.description: Number of rows to add.

params.name: values
params.description: Optional 2D array. Cells are filled if the corresponding strings are specified in the array.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. Call `context.sync()` before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: `propertyNamesAndPaths.select` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and `propertyNamesAndPaths.expand` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. Accepts either a plain object with the appropriate properties or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

params.name: cellPaddingLocation
params.description: The cell padding location must be 'Top', 'Left', 'Bottom', or 'Right'.

params.name: cellPadding
params.description: The cell padding.

params.name: cellPaddingLocation
params.description: The cell padding location must be 'Top', 'Left', 'Bottom', or 'Right'.

params.name: cellPadding
params.description: The cell padding.

methods.name: split
methods.description: Splits the cell into the specified number of rows and columns.

params.name: rowCount
params.description: The number of rows to split into. Must be a divisor of the number of underlying rows.

params.name: columnCount
params.description: The number of columns to split into.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript `toJSON()` method to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to `JSON.stringify()`. Returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as `Word.Interfaces.TableCellData`) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. Shorthand for `context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)`.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. Shorthand for `context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)`. Call `context.sync()` for the release to take effect.
